synthesis_analysis: The AI excels at validating feelings and breaking challenges into practical, manageable steps, which builds trust. Its main weakness is prematurely offering techniques before fully exploring or addressing the core cognitive distortion (e.g., fear of judgment). Improvement requires prioritizing emotional safety by first reframing distortions and exploring resistance, then tailoring skill-building to individual anxiety profiles. The highest priority is evolving to detect subtle pivots in student concerns and adapt its approach to high-anxiety students by delaying social exposure and physiological hacks.
